Class TicTacTix

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacTix

  • public class TicTacTix
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the core logic/template for a TicTacTix game. This class provides the logic for checking win conditions and the general control flow of the game.
    Version:
    March 28, 2019
    Author:
    Ri Xin Yang

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicTacTix

        public TicTacTix(int dimensions,
                 boolean isFirst)
        Parameterized constructor of the TicTacTix class. Creates an appropriate game setup depending on dimensions and the data on which player gets to go first.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - - (int) The dimensions of the even grid. Layer, row, and column will be determined by this.
        isFirst - - (boolean) Determines if the user gets to go first in the game.
        See Also:
        reserveMiddle()

    • Method Detail

      • getComputerMove

        public int[] getComputerMove()
        A method that randomly generates a valid move that the computer can make. This valid move will be returned as an integer array consisting of three elements. The first will indicate the layer, the second for the row, and the third indicating the column. Note: Since the move is randomly generated and checked without logging, it may take a while for the generator to get a valid position on the game board. This is especially evident when there are 1-2 remaining cells on the grid.
        Returns:
        int[] - The coordinates of a valid move that the computer may make. They order from layer, row, and column.
        See Also:
        Random, move(int layer, int row, int column)

      • move

        public boolean move(int layer,
                    int row,
                    int column)
        A method that reads the coordinates of called move. See if that move is valid on the grid. If valid, execute the move and return true. Otherwise, return false.
        Parameters:
        layer - - (int) The passed in layer of the move.
        row - - (int) The passed in row of the move.
        column - - (int) The passed in column of the move.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns a status determining if the move is valid or not.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        This method checks if the current game is over. This is used to determine when the game loop stops. Specifically, this method checks the hasWon() method followed by checking if all the cells has been filled out. If game is over, return true, otherwise return false.
        Returns:
        boolean - a status that determines if the game is over or not.
        See Also:
        hasWon()

      • hasWon

        public boolean hasWon()
        This method checks the win condition and see if there is a winner in the following grid. This method will check if there is a win by getting all possible 2D grids in the 3D game board. After this, each of the 2D game board will be checked by the method which determines if there is a win in a 2D grid. If there is a win, the logic will be stopped and a boolean status indicating whether there is a win will be returned.
        Returns:
        boolean - determines whether there is a win in the 3D game board.
        See Also:
        has2DWon(int[][] grid)

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public int getCurrentPlayer()
        A accessor method that returns the value of "currentPlayer", an instance variable.
        Returns:
        int - currentPlayer, used to determine current player turn.

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        A accessor method that returns the value of "winner", an instance variable.
        Returns:
        int - winner, used to represent the winner of the game.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A method that is used to print the grid, displaying the game status along with the visual aid of the grid. This method is to be used to help the user understand the current status of the game.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - status with representation of the grid.
        See Also:
        getHeadingStatus(), getCellStatus()
